beats.text: This is a demonstration of the GUI Chat Protocol in action.
The user just typed 'hi' to start the conversation.
The LLM acting as a recipe guide dynamically generate a form and calls presentForm tool to present it to the user.
Notice that the form is presented to the user as a part of the chat application interface.
This style of interaction is enabled by the GUI Chat Protocol. It is easier for the user than giving a responce in a free format text.
When the user fills out the form and submits it, the chat application forward it to the LLM.
From LLM's perspective, it just looks like a message from the user, in a JSON object format.
The schema of this JSON objet is defined by the LLM itself when it calls the presentForm tool.
The 'presentForm' tool is a powerful feature that allows the LLM to receive structured data from the user, which is not possible with traditional text-based chat applications.
Based on this structured responce, the LLM generates a recipe document in an enhanced version of markdown and calls the presentDocument tool to present it to the user.
The this enhanced markdown document allows the LLM to embbed images in the document, specifying the image prompt for each image.
The presentDocument tool generates those images using specified image prompts.
Notice that the generated document with embedded images is much more engaging than a plain text responce from typical chat applications.
This rich interactive experience is enabled by the GUI Chat Protocol.
